headline: Republican Kinzinger: I should have voted to impeach Trump over Ukraine
author: Martin Pengelly
sentences:
Alexander Vindman [a White House official who was fired for opposing Trump's Ukraine scheme] and others deserve our appreciation.?
No House Republicans voted to impeach Trump over the Ukraine scandal, which saw only the Utah senator Mitt Romney vote to convict in the Senate.

One of two Republicans on the House January 6 committee has said he regrets his vote against the first impeachment of Donald Trump, for withholding military aid to Ukraine in an attempt to obtain dirt on rivals including Joe Biden.

In tweets posted on Friday, as the Russian invasion of Ukraine continued, with cities besieged and bombarded, Adam Kinzinger said: I want to be honest, in Congress I have only a few votes that in hinds[igh]t, I regret.
Kinzinger is also among such Republicans who have announced that they will retire at the next election, rather than face a Trump-anointed challenger.
What we can do now is to ensure that this never happens again, and that we all put the interests of our nation above our party.
Kinzinger, from Illinois, was one of 10 House Republicans who voted to impeach him for inciting the deadly Capitol attack.
The bottom line, Donald Trump withheld lethal aid to Ukraine so he could use it as leverage for his campaign.
Trump is in legal jeopardy over January 6, his attempts to overturn the election and his business affairs.
Liz Cheney of Wyoming, the other Republican on the January 6 committee, faces such a primary challenge.
But he still dominates the Republican party and polling of possible presidential nominees in 2024.
She also voted not to impeach Trump over Ukraine but to impeach him over the Capitol riot.
It's important for political leaders to be transparent and admit regret when needed.
This is a shameful and illegal act, directly hurting the Ukraine defense today.
My biggest regret was voting against the first impeachment of Donald Trump.
I wish I could go back in time and vote for it, but I cannot.
He has hinted heavily and repeatedly that he will indeed run.
